title: New CCTV released in hunt for Tommy Ward murderer
text:
Tommy Ward was found with serious injuries at his home in Maltby Police investigating the murder of a great grandad from Rotherham have issued a CCTV appeal on the anniversary of his death.
80-year-old Tommy Ward died on 23 February 2016, almost five months after a violent robbery at his house in Maltby.
About £30,000 was thought to have been stolen from his home on Salisbury Road home during the raid. £33,000 was then raised by the public for Tommy.
£30,000 was raised for Tommy Ward before his death Credit: gofundme New footage shows a Saab 93 twice driven past the ex-miner's property less than an hour before the attack.
Play video Det Ch Insp Victoria Short said the vehicle was seen turning right onto Salisbury Road from Grange Lane at about 05:15 BST on 1 October 2015.
It drove past Mr Ward's house before making a U-turn and driving back down the road. It was later seen on CCTV turning back onto Grange Lane from Salisbury Road at 05:40.
Police are still searching for Tommy's killer It drove past Mr Ward's house before making a U-turn and driving back down the road. It was later seen on CCTV turning back onto Grange Lane from Salisbury Road at 05:40.
Just before 5am Tommy's lights are out they are not on and just before 6am his lights are on so I believe attack happened during that period of time the car was obviously on that road during that time and was parked up for approximately 25 minutes so it's either the people that are involved in the offence or it is a significant witness.
– Det Ch Insp Victoria Short Last updated Thu 23 Feb 2017 South Yorkshire Rotherham
